body:
FWIW if you use bash as shell, you need to escape the `!` here to not get a `-bash: !host_build: event not found` error
(I tried executing this command separately to test it)
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

doesn't look like this line is working, there's no bare "QMAKE_LFLAGS" in my `win32-g++/qmake.conf` at all (qt 5.9.7 nor 5.9.8)
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \
+  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS           += |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \
   sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_LFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_LFLAGS            = $($(package)_ldflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

body: Should we explicitly set `SHELL` then? The default is `/bin/sh` I think.
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

body:
`/bin/sh` means nothing specific, it's the default system shell. Isn't it theoretically possible for `/bin/sh` to be bash?
Escaping the ! would be easier, I guess.
Not that it necessarily needs to be solved, here, it's not a new problem, I was just surprised.
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

body: Ah gotcha, perhaps you know this already: when `argv[0]` looks like it's `sh`, I believe `bash` will be in posix-compliant mode.
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

body: Digging a little into this... It would seem that `QMAKE_LFAGS` was removed in https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/39fc377bf105ba09e2a8f9acae467dc789b96525, and first made it into qt `v5.9.0`. We can just add `QMAKE_LFLAGS            = $($(package)_ldflags)` back in though.
diff_hunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
   patch -p1 -i $($(package)_patch_dir)/no-xlib.patch &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX = 10" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
   echo "QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_SCRIPT = object_script" >> qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf &&\
-  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \
+  sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_CFLAGS           += |!host_build: QMAKE_CFLAGS            = $($(package)_cflags) $($(package)_cppflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \
   sed -i.old "s|QMAKE_LFLAGS            = |!host_build: QMAKE_LFLAGS            = $($(package)_ldflags) |" qtbase/mkspecs/win32-g++/qmake.conf && \

@@ -178,9 +178,9 @@ define $(package)_preprocess_cmds

body: Requested a new gitian build. ACK from me if it passes.
Looks good to me, thanks for addressing this
